content.question: Which of the following provides the weakest evidence that mitochondria were once free-living prokaryotes?

choices.label: Mitochondrial ribosomes resemble those of prokaryotes.
Mitochondria have DNA that is circular and does not have associated protein.
Enzyme pathways on mitochondrial membranes resemble those found on modern prokaryote membranes.
Mitochondria reproduce by a process similar to binary fission.
Mitochondria and prokaryotes both are found in a variety of sizes.

content.answer: Mitochondria and prokaryotes both are found in a variety of sizes.

skill.text: 6.B: Support a claim with evidence from biological principles, concepts, processes, and data.
